Description (string): Press the interact button near the water to cast. Press it again when you get a bite!
"The bearer of this badge may officially participate in the 203rd Ensomme Fishing Festival."

"Need bait? Stock up in the town square. Our vendors replenish their inventory daily. Caught a big one? Take it to the white tent in front of the church to have it officially recorded! To preserve our ecology and quality, only officially recorded fish can be sold to the fishmonger."
Mr. Petterson has loaned you the red trailer south of town square for the duration of the festival.
A small silvery fish.
It's large and has eight suction-cupped tentacles.
It has a strange shape for a fish, with a curly tail and long mouth.
This thing takes two hands to carry.
It has a big smooth head with a gaping mouth full of pointy teeth. Eeek!
It's bright yellow, long and tubular.
It's a large fish that looks pretty old...
It has a distinct brown color.
It has a distinct dark color.
It has strange whiskers coming off of it's chin, like a goatee.
A cute, small crustacean.
A small silvery fish that women on the island enjoy. It prefers to eat sardines and blood worms.
The giant octopus hatches a "super brood" of 100,000 eggs that the mother guards for six months. It prefers to eat squid and occasionally sardines.
Seahorse fathers carry eggs in a pouch on their tale for up to 45 days. It prefers to eat blood worms and squid.
A large fish popular for sport fishing. Men on the island love them. It prefers to eat little bonito.
It's ugly and eats everything that fits in its gaping mouth. But it tastes great!
This tubular fish has a golden, yellow color. It prefers to eat sardines and squid.
This large fish can live for over 200 years! It prefers to eat little bonito and squid.
Named for it's brown to auburn color. It prefers to eat worms and squid.
A huge dark fish that prefers to eat little bonitio.
represents? eats bonito
This fish uses its goatee-like barbels to search for food. It prefers to eat blood worms and sardines.
Small and cute. But also quite tasty! It prefers to eat blood worms and squid.
Even in this remote place there's somehow trash in the ocean. What a shame.
It looks like a bone of some sort. It's fairly large.
A piece of some old garment.
A gold locket with a note stuffed inside that reads: “Ingrid - This is a promise that I’ll never forget you, so long as you never forget me. Love, Nora”

"A Prayer for Oliver: May the waves cradle you, though I will not. May the salt preserve you, though I will grow older. May the currents guide you to salvation, though they will not guide you back to me."
These worms bleed when you skewer them onto a hook.
A tiny fish used to catch small and medium sized fish.
Hunks of squid cut into a size that fits well on a fish hook.
A small fish used to catch big fish.
A gross glob of meat. Is that a fingernail?
